intro: Borzicactus trollii, commonly known as the desert hedgehog cactus, is a unique cactus species native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny stems that form a globular or cylindrical shape, often resembling a hedgehog. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically short-lived but attract various pollinators. Its thick, fleshy stems are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in extreme desert conditions. Borzicactus trollii is a slow-growing plant that thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight.
